headline: Walmart's Sam's Club changes its operating hours
summary: Sam's Club has expanded its operating hours.Costco recently did the same, but just for some members.Not everyone is happy with Costco. Walmart's Sam's Club has decided to extend its operating hours for all members beginning on Oct. 21. The move comes after a controversial Costco move to stay open ...

headline: Walmart Highlights U.S. Manufacturing and Small Business Growth at 2025 Open Call
summary: BENTONVILLE, Ark., October 09, 2025--Walmart held its 12th annual Open Call this week, welcoming over 500 entrepreneurs from 47 states, Washington, D.C., and Puerto Rico. Each came ready to pitch products made, grown or assembled in the United States directly to Walmart and Sam’s Club merchants.

headline: Amazon Prime’s Big Deal Days Were a Success. Here’s What Items People Bought.
summary: Amazon.com’s Prime Big Deal Days were a hit with deal-hunting consumers looking to stock up on household essentials, early data suggests.  Analysts expected Amazon’s two-day October sale, which ended Wednesday, to kick-start the holiday shopping season.  Amazon’s website traffic increased about 21% in the first 36 hours of Prime Big Deal Days compared with the prior five days, marking a “robust response” to the sales, writes Joseph Feldman, an analyst at Telsey Advisory Group, citing data from Google Trends.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: AMD, Delta, PepsiCo, Coinbase, Costco, AZZ, and More
summary: Stock futures traded flat Thursday as moves toward peace in the Middle East removed a key geopolitical worry for markets, and investors awaited the kickoff of earnings season with reports from PepsiCo and Delta Air Lines.  Advanced Micro Devices  rose 0.9% in premarket trading after the chip maker finished up 11% Wednesday at $235.56, a record high.  Dell Technologies  fell 0.6%.

headline: PepsiCo Announces New Chief Financial Officer
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ: PEP) today named Steve Schmitt Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective November 10, 2025. Jamie Caulfield has decided to retire next year after a more than 30-year career with the company. Jamie will remain CFO until November 10, 2025, at which time he will assume an advisory role and assist with the transition through May 15, 2026.

Jamie will remain CFO until November 10, 2025, at which time he will assume an advisory role and assist with the transition through May 15, 2026.
